org.mmbase.module.lucene

Class JdbcIndexDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mmbase.module.lucene.JdbcIndexDefinition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexDefinition

    public class JdbcIndexDefinition
extends Object
implements IndexDefinition
    If for some reason you also need to do Queries next to MMBase.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Michiel Meeuwissen

      • getDirectConnection

        protected Connection getDirectConnection()
                                  throws SQLException
        Jdbc connection pooling of MMBase would kill the statement if too duratious. This produces a 'direct connection' in that case, to circumvent that problem (Indexing queries _may_ take a while).
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • getNode

        public Node getNode(Cloud userCloud,
                    org.apache.lucene.document.Document doc)
        Description copied from interface: IndexDefinition
        Defines how a Node for this index must be produced. For MMBase indices this is of course quite straight-forward, but other indices may create virtual nodes here.
        Specified by:
        getNode in interface IndexDefinition

      • getCursor

        public CloseableIterator<JdbcIndexDefinition.JdbcEntry> getCursor()
        Description copied from interface: IndexDefinition
        Returns an Iterator over all IndexEntry's defined by this index. Only makes sense if this is not a 'sub definition'.
        Specified by:
        getCursor in interface IndexDefinition

      • getSubCursor

        public CloseableIterator<JdbcIndexDefinition.JdbcEntry> getSubCursor(String identifier)
        Description copied from interface: IndexDefinition
        Returns an Iterator over all IndexEntry's defined by this index, restricted by a certain identifier. For a 'top' level index definition, this should normally return only one Entry, and the key must be the identifier of this entry. For 'nested' IndexDefinitions, the key most be the key of the parent.
        Specified by:
        getSubCursor in interface IndexDefinition

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
